subject: Re: [junit] MIDP Testing Tools
msgSnippet: ... Katie, The only one I am aware of is J2MEUnit, which is a port of JUnit and is currently limited to MIDP 1.0. It is also pre- JDK 1.4 which means
messageBody:
Katie Gerg wrote:

> Does anyone know of any MIDP testing tools?

Katie,

The only one I am aware of is J2MEUnit, which is a port of
JUnit and is currently limited to MIDP 1.0. It is also pre-
JDK 1.4 which means Assert.assert() and the assert keyword
will collide. The good news is it is easy to change Assert.assert()
to Assert.assertTrue(). The bad news is I've been fighting
with getting the preverifier to work for several days now
without success. Perhaps success is just around the corner...

Maybe you will have more luck. If you do, please let me know
what the trick is! <G>

http://www.xprogramming.com/ftp/TestingFramework/j2me/J2MEUnit1_0.zip
--
Thanks,
Derek Lane
=====================================
--- The Gunslinger
